Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black (mostly worn) with lotus flower or rosette in faded added white outline; exterior: painted decoration consisting of sphinx to left (back of hair, part of curlicue, part of wing with small added red blob and part of belly remaining).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 288, no. 857)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1029) (phase 2)
